metalign.hierarchy.fromfile

Class FromFileHierarchyModelState

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.generic.MidiModelState
      • metalign.hierarchy.HierarchyModelState
        • metalign.hierarchy.fromfile.FromFileHierarchyModelState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MidiModelState>

    public class FromFileHierarchyModelState
extends HierarchyModelState
    A FromFileHierarchyModelState grabs the correct metrical structure from the MIDI file and uses that to construct the proper hierarchy.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 2 Dec, 2015

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Measure measure
      The Measure of this metrical structure.
      private long mostRecentTime
      The time of the most recent note onset we've seen so far.
      private TimeTracker tt
      The time tracker from this hierarchy state.

      • FromFileHierarchyModelState

        private FromFileHierarchyModelState(Measure measure,
                                    long mostRecentTime,
                                    TimeTracker tt)
        Create a new FromFileHierarchyModelState and initialize the fileds as given. This is private as it is only used to clone this object from within the handleIncoming(List) method.
        Parameters:
        measure - measure
        mostRecentTime - mostRecentTime
        tt - tt

      • getScore

        public double getScore()
        Description copied from class: MidiModelState
        Get the score of this MidiModelState. In general, a higher score reflects that a State is more likely given our prior knowledge. The natural ordering of MidiModelStates is based on this score value.
        Specified by:
        getScore in class MidiModelState
        Returns:
        The score of this MidiModelState.
